turns.content: I'm thinking of upgrading my car's suspension and was wondering if you could help me find some reviews on coilovers for a 2018 Honda Civic Si.

Upgrading your suspension can make a huge difference in your car's handling and ride quality.

I'd be happy to help you find reviews on coilovers for your 2018 Honda Civic Si. Here are a few options and resources to get you started:

**Coilover Brands and Reviews:**

1. **Tein**: Tein is a well-known brand in the suspension industry, and their coilovers are popular among Honda enthusiasts. Here's a review from CivicX.com: [Tein S.Tech Lowering Springs Review](https://civicx.com/forums/threads/tein-s-tech-lowering-springs-review.15111/).
2. **KW Suspension**: KW is another reputable brand that offers coilovers for the 2018 Honda Civic Si. Here's a review from Honda-Tech.com: [KW V3 Coilovers Review](https://honda-tech.com/forums/showthread.php?t=4320119).
3. **Megan Racing**: Megan Racing is a popular choice among Honda enthusiasts, and their coilovers are known for their affordability and performance. Here's a review from YouTube: [Megan Racing Coilovers Review (2018 Honda Civic Si)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7xQW4JwZp3Q).
4. **Fortune Auto**: Fortune Auto is a US-based company that offers high-performance coilovers for the Honda Civic Si. Here's a review from Reddit: [Fortune Auto 500 Coilovers Review (2018 Honda Civic Si)](https://www.reddit.com/r/CivicSi/comments/9j9g1l/fortune_auto_500_coilovers_review/).
5. **Swift Springs**: Swift Springs is a Japanese company that specializes in high-performance springs and coilovers. Here's a review from Honda-Tech.com: [Swift Springs Coilovers Review](https://honda-tech.com/forums/showthread.php?t=4303119).

**Review Websites and Forums:**

1. **CivicX.com**: A dedicated forum for 10th-gen Honda Civic owners, including the Si model.
2. **Honda-Tech.com**: A comprehensive forum for all things Honda, including suspension upgrades and coilover reviews.
3. **Reddit (r/CivicSi)**: A community-driven subreddit for Honda Civic Si owners, with many threads on suspension upgrades and coilover reviews.

When researching coilovers, make sure to read reviews from multiple sources and consider factors like:

* Ride quality and comfort
* Handling and performance
* Installation difficulty
* Customer support and warranty
* Price and value

Remember to also check the compatibility and specifications of the coilovers with your vehicle before making a purchase.

I hope this helps you get started on your search for the perfect coilovers for your 2018 Honda Civic Si!

I'll definitely check out those reviews. By the way, I've been thinking about my track days and realized that my first autocross event was on April 17th, which feels like ages ago. Can you help me find some local tracks that offer high-performance driving education (HPDE) events?

Happy to help!

It's great that you're eager to get back on track (pun intended!). Finding local tracks with HPDE events can be a bit of a challenge, but I've got some resources to help you out:

**Online Track Finders:**

1. **TrackHQ**: A comprehensive directory of tracks in the US and Canada. You can filter by state, track type, and event type (including HPDE). [TrackHQ Website](https://www.trackhq.com/)
2. **NASA (National Auto Sport Association)**: NASA offers HPDE events across the US, and their website allows you to search for tracks and events by region. [NASA Website](https://www.nasaproracing.com/)
3. **SCCA (Sports Car Club of America)**: The SCCA is another well-established organization that offers HPDE events nationwide. You can search for tracks and events on their website. [SCCA Website](https://www.scca.com/)
4. **TrackDays**: A website that lists track days and HPDE events across the US. You can filter by state, track, and event type. [TrackDays Website](https://www.trackdays.com/)

**Local Car Clubs and Organizations:**

1. **Local SCCA Chapters**: Reach out to your local SCCA chapter to ask about HPDE events and tracks in your area. [SCCA Chapter Finder](https://www.scca.com/about/regions)
2. **NASA Regions**: NASA has regional chapters that organize HPDE events. Find your local region and contact them for information on upcoming events. [NASA Region Finder](https://www.nasaproracing.com/about/regions)
3. **BMW CCA (Car Club of America) Chapters**: If you have a BMW, or even if you don't, the BMW CCA often hosts HPDE events at various tracks. Find your local chapter and ask about upcoming events. [BMW CCA Chapter Finder](https://www.bmwcca.org/chapters)
4. **Porsche Club of America (PCA) Regions**: Similar to the BMW CCA, the PCA hosts HPDE events at various tracks. Find your local region and ask about upcoming events. [PCA Region Finder](https://www.pca.org/regions)

**Social Media and Online Forums:**

1. **Facebook Groups**: Join local car enthusiast groups or track-specific groups to ask about HPDE events and get recommendations from fellow enthusiasts.
2. **Reddit (r/trackday)**: A community-driven subreddit for track enthusiasts. You can ask about local tracks and HPDE events in your area.
3. **Local Car Forums**: Look for online forums dedicated to your car's make or model, and ask about HPDE events and track recommendations.

Remember to always research the track, the event organizer, and the safety record before signing up for an HPDE event.

Good luck, and I hope you find some exciting track opportunities near you!

I didn't know there were so many resources available. I'll definitely check them out. By the way, do you think it's a good idea to get a performance alignment after installing the new coilovers? I've heard it can make a big difference in handling.

Getting a performance alignment after installing new coilovers is highly recommended. Here's why:

**Why a Performance Alignment Matters:**

1. **Optimal Camber and Toe Settings**: Coilovers can change the suspension geometry, affecting camber and toe settings. A performance alignment ensures these settings are optimized for your new suspension, which can improve handling, tire wear, and overall performance.
2. **Improved Handling and Stability**: A performance alignment can help your car corner more predictably, reduce understeer or oversteer, and improve overall stability at high speeds.
3. **Better Tire Wear**: Proper alignment helps distribute tire wear evenly, which can extend the life of your tires and improve their overall performance.
4. **Enhanced Safety**: A well-aligned vehicle is more stable and responsive, which can help you avoid accidents and maintain control in emergency situations.

**What to Expect from a Performance Alignment:**

A performance alignment typically includes:

1. **Camber adjustment**: The technician will adjust the camber to optimize the angle of the wheels, which can improve handling and tire wear.
2. **Toe adjustment**: The technician will adjust the toe to ensure the wheels are pointing straight ahead, which can improve stability and reduce tire wear.
3. **Ride height adjustment**: The technician may adjust the ride height to optimize the suspension's performance and ensure proper clearance.
4. **Suspension geometry checks**: The technician will inspect the suspension components to ensure they're properly aligned and functioning as intended.

**Tips for Getting a Performance Alignment:**

1. **Choose a reputable shop**: Select a shop with experience in performance alignments and knowledge of your vehicle's make and model.
2. **Provide detailed information**: Inform the technician about your new coilovers, driving style, and any specific handling issues you're experiencing.
3. **Ask about their process**: Inquire about the shop's alignment process, including the tools and software they use, to ensure they're using the latest technology.
4. **Get a before-and-after assessment**: Ask the technician to assess your vehicle's alignment before and after the performance alignment to demonstrate the improvements.

By getting a performance alignment after installing your new coilovers, you'll be able to unlock the full potential of your suspension upgrade and enjoy improved handling, stability, and overall performance.

I'll definitely look into getting a performance alignment after installing the coilovers. Do you know if I can track my car's performance and lap times using any apps or devices? I've heard of some people using data loggers to improve their driving skills.

Tracking your car's performance and lap times can be a great way to improve your driving skills and optimize your vehicle's setup. There are several apps, devices, and data loggers available to help you do just that. Here are some popular options:

**GPS-Based Lap Timing Apps:**

1. **Harry's Lap Timer** (iOS, Android): A popular app that uses GPS to track your lap times, speed, and other performance metrics.
2. **TrackAddict** (iOS, Android): Another well-known app that provides detailed lap timing, speed, and performance data, along with video analysis features.
3. **Racing Line** (iOS, Android): A GPS-based app that tracks your lap times, speed, and acceleration, with features like sector timing and performance analysis.

**Data Loggers and Performance Monitoring Devices:**

1. **AiM Sports** (Various Devices): AiM Sports offers a range of data loggers and performance monitoring devices that can track your car's speed, acceleration, braking, and other performance metrics.
2. **Racepak** (Various Devices): Racepak provides data loggers and performance monitoring systems that can track your car's performance, including speed, acceleration, and lap times.
3. **Garmin VIRB** (Garmin VIRB Ultra 30): A high-end action camera that can also track your car's performance, including speed, acceleration, and lap times.

**OBD-II Devices:**

1. **OBDLink** (Various Devices): OBDLink offers a range of OBD-II devices that can track your car's performance, including speed, acceleration, and engine data.
2. **PLX Devices** (Various Devices): PLX Devices provides OBD-II devices that can track your car's performance, including speed, acceleration, and engine data, along with features like data logging and analytics.

**Tips for Using Data Loggers and Performance Monitoring Devices:**

1. **Choose a device that fits your needs**: Select a device that tracks the data you're interested in, and consider the level of detail and analysis you need.
2. **Install and configure the device correctly**: Ensure the device is properly installed and configured to provide accurate data.
3. **Analyze and interpret the data**: Take the time to review and understand the data to identify areas for improvement in your driving and vehicle setup.
4. **Use the data to adjust your driving style**: Make adjustments to your driving style based on the data, and track your progress over time.

By using a data logger or performance monitoring device, you can gain valuable insights into your car's performance and your driving skills, helping you to improve your lap times and overall driving abilities.

I've heard that some of these devices can also provide real-time feedback and alerts during a track session. Do you think that's something that could be helpful for a driver like me who's still learning and improving?

Real-time feedback and alerts can be incredibly valuable for a driver like you who's still learning and improving. Here's why:

**Real-Time Feedback:**

1. **Immediate Insights**: Real-time feedback provides instant insights into your driving, allowing you to adjust your technique on the fly.
2. **Improved Consistency**: With real-time feedback, you can maintain a consistent pace and driving style, which is crucial for improvement.
3. **Quicker Learning**: Real-time feedback accelerates the learning process, as you can correct mistakes and adjust your technique more quickly.

**Alerts and Warnings:**

1. **Safety**: Alerts and warnings can help prevent accidents or spins by alerting you to potential dangers, such as exceeding track limits or approaching a spin.
2. **Performance Optimization**: Alerts can notify you when you're not optimizing your speed or braking, helping you to refine your driving technique.
3. **Focus and Concentration**: Alerts and warnings can help maintain your focus and concentration during a track session, ensuring you stay engaged and aware.

**Devices with Real-Time Feedback and Alerts:**

1. **AiM Sports**: AiM Sports devices, such as the AiM Solo 2, provide real-time feedback and alerts, including lap times, sector times, and speed.
2. **Racepak**: Racepak devices, like the Racepak IQ3, offer real-time feedback and alerts, including speed, acceleration, and braking data.
3. **Garmin VIRB**: The Garmin VIRB Ultra 30 provides real-time feedback and alerts, including speed, acceleration, and lap times, along with video analysis features.

**Tips for Using Real-Time Feedback and Alerts:**

1. **Configure the device to your needs**: Customize the alerts and feedback to focus on the areas you want to improve.
2. **Use the data to adjust your driving**: Make adjustments to your driving style based on the real-time feedback and alerts.
3. **Practice and refine your skills**: Use the real-time feedback and alerts to refine your skills and develop muscle memory.
4. **Review and analyze the data**: After the track session, review the data to identify areas for further improvement.

By leveraging real-time feedback and alerts, you can take your driving skills to the next level and improve your performance on the track.
I'll make sure to consider getting a device with real-time feedback and alerts for my next track session. Thanks for the advice!

You're welcome! I'm glad I could help. Remember, the key to improving your driving skills is to stay focused, persistent, and open to learning. With the right tools and mindset, you'll be carving up the track in no time!

If you have any more questions or need further guidance, don't hesitate to ask. I'll be here, cheering you on from the virtual pits!

Safe driving, and I'll see you at the track!
